To all who shall see or hear this writing, Andrew of Wasford, son and heir of the late Simon of Wasford, burgess of Ayr, greeting in the Lord: Wit ye me in my lawful power to have given, granted, and by this my present charter, for me and my heirs for ever confirmed, to God and St. Katherine the virgin, and the house of the Friars Preachers of Ayr, sor the weal of my soul, and of the souls of my parents and successors, 3116. of all the faithful dead, and for light to be burned on the high altar of the fore- said convent, that tenement which formerly was my fathefs, and which in my time I have given to Margaret my wife, for her lifetime, lying between the land of the late Reginald Allvynson on the one part, and the land of Baty Flessor on the other, with the kiln, and two perches of land next the said kiln, and one croft called the Orukithalf acre, lying between the Oamergate and the long croft of the soresaid F riars of Ayr.
